alert.note: Alert for Lenawee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 11:37AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Monroe, northeastern Lenawee and southern Washtenaw Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1137 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brooklyn, or near Manchester, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Manchester around 1145 AM EDT. Tecumseh around 1200 PM EDT. Adrian around 1205 PM EDT. Britton around 1215 PM EDT. Dundee, Petersburg and Deerfield around 1230 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Cone, Macon, Bridgewater, Ridgeway, Palmyra, Pleasant Lake, Tipton, Rome Center and Azalia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
